intro: Aconitum howellii, commonly known as Howell's monkshood, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive helmet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant features palmately compound leaves with five to seven leaflets, and it produces showy, spurred flowers that attract pollinators. Aconitum howellii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. It is important to note that all parts of this plant are toxic and should be handled with care.
